III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On or around 11/04/24, Youth A had to be restrained due to their
behavior. Youth A’s shirt was caught over the handcuff restraints
during which time, Administrator 1 choked Youth A with the
youth's shirt.
Investigation JJ Worker was interviewed via telephone on 11/12/2024. JJ
Worker reported Youth A has a history of being aggressive with
staff and other youths. She was informed of the incident and
expressed no concerns for the facility.
Administrator 1 was interviewed at the facility on 11/13/2024,
in collaboration with MDHHS Specialist 1. Administrator 1
reported on 10/29/2024, he assisted with an incident involving
Youth A. He said Youth A asked for a break in the rose garden, so
staff allowed him to go outside. After 30 minutes Youth A refused
to comeback inside. He and Administrator 2 went outside to
assist. Youth A held on to the fence and started to kick and spit on
staff. An attempt was made to escort Youth A inside, Youth A
became more escalated and assaultive, therefore Youth A was
put in a mechanical restraint and escorted to his bedroom. He
denied anyone choked or hurt Youth A.
Administrator 2 was interviewed at the facility on 11/13/2024,
in collaboration with MDHHS Specialist 1. Administrator 2
reported there was an incident on 10/29/2024 involving Youth A
being in the rose garden for a break and after 30 minutes he
refused to come back inside. She and Administrator 1 were
outside and attempted to talk to Youth A, but Youth A became
assaultive with staff, and they had to use a mechanical restraint.
She said Youth A told Supervisor 1 he is going to lie about being
choked so that he can get the facility shut down.
2

Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 11/13/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist 1. Youth A recalled the
incident and said that he was having flashbacks of a car accident
he was involved in and asked for a 5-minute break outside. He
was not ready to comeback inside, so he held on to the fence and
that’s when Staff 1 and Staff 2 threw him to the ground and put
him in handcuffs. He said Administrator 1 told Staff 1 and Staff 2 if
Youth A didn’t come inside, Youth A would be placed in handcuffs.
Youth A admitted he spit on Staff 1 and Staff 2, and that’s when
they put his shirt over his face to stop him from spitting. Youth A
said Administrator 1 grabbed Youth’s A shirt that was around his
neck and choked him. Youth A said he was transferred to his
room and was examined by the nurse after the incident. He
denied having any marks or bruises from being choked but does
have bruises on his wrists from the handcuffs. Youth A admitted
he told Supervisor 1 he was going to get the facility shut down like
he did at his previous placement.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 11/13/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist 1. Staff 1 has been
working at the facility for six months. Staff 1 reported on
10/29/2024, he was outside assisting with trying to get Youth A to
come back to the unit. Youth A refused, held on the fence, head-
butted, and spit on him and the other staff. Youth A was put in
handcuffs and escorted back to his room. Staff 1 denied Youth A
was choked or hurt while being escorted to his room. Staff 1 has
never witnessed Administrator 1 physically assault or hurt any of
the youths. Staff 1 said Youth A is very manipulative when he
does not get his way.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed at facility on 11/13/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist 1. Supervisor 1 reported
she did not witness the incident on 10/29/2024. She said Youth A
has been upset with staff because he had letters removed from
his room that had sexually explicit narrative written, therefore he
has been upset with Administrator 1. She said after the letters
were removed from his room Youth A told her, he was going to get
this place closed down because he lied and told his worker that
Administrator 1 choked him. Supervisor 1 denied witnessing any
staff or Administrator 1 choke or hurt Youth A. She said Youth A is
very aggressive, has made raciest comments, used the “n” word,
assaulted staff, and other youths at the facility. She said
Administrator 1 goes above and beyond for the all the youths and
would never do anything to hurt them.
3

Supervisor 2 was interviewed at facility on 11/13/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist 1. Supervisor 2 reported
she witnessed the incident involving Youth A on 10/29/2024.
Youth A had asked for a 5-minute break and wanted to go outside
to the rose garden. After 30 minutes Youth A refused to come
back to the unit. She tried to convince Youth A to come inside,
and he replied, “fuck this program.” Youth A was very escalated,
spitting and assaulting Staff 1 and Staff 2. Youth A was put in a
mechanical restraint and escorted back to the unit. She denied
Youth A was choked or that his shirt was removed. She said
Administrator never restrained or choked Youth A.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 11/26/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist 2. Youth B reported he
has been at the facility for six months and has never been
restrained. Youth B reported feeling safe and did not express any
concerns regarding Administrator 1.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on 12/04/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist 1. Staff 2 reported he and
Staff 1 were trying to get Youth A to come back inside after being
outside for 30 minutes. Youth A refused to come inside, he
grabbed the fence and started to kick and punch Staff 1 and Staff
2. He said they tried to verbally de-escalate Youth A, but he
continued to assault staff, so Administrator 1 approved for Staff 1
and Staff 2 to put Youth A in a mechanical restraint. He said Youth
A was spitting on them, therefore a spit mask (which is a mesh or
fabric device designed to prevent spitting while allowing for normal
breathing and visibility) was put over his face. He denied Youth A
was choked by Administrator 1.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on 12/04/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist 1. Staff 3 recalled the
incident involving Youth A on 10/29/2024. Staff 3 witnessed Youth
A spitting, and assaulting Staff 1 and Staff 2. Staff 3 reported
Youth A was put in handcuffs and escorted back to the unit. He
denied Administrator 1, or any other staff choked Youth A with his
shirt. Staff 3 said Administrator 1 was not involved during the
restraint.
Supervisor 3 was interviewed via telephone on 12/04/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist 1. Supervisor 3 recalled
the incident and reported a code blue was called due to Youth A
assaulting staff and refusing to come inside. He responding to the
call and observed Youth A kicking, punching, and spitting on Staff.
4

He said a spit mask was put over Youth’s face. He denied Youth A
was choked or hurt by Administrator 1. He said Youth A was the
one that was assaulting staff and at no point did staff do anything
to hurt Youth A.
Video reviewed:
Video of the incident was reviewed on 11/13/2024. The video is
dated for 10/29/2024 at approximately 1:57 pm, The restraint
occurred near the fence in the rose garden which is out of the
camera view. Youth A was observed being escorted from the rose
garden back to his bedroom in handcuffs by Staff 1 and Staff 2. At
no point during the escort is Youth A choked, or face is covered.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 10/29/2024, completed by Manager.
Youth A was allowed to go to the rose garden to refocus,
after 35 minutes in the rose garden, Youth A refused to
come back inside. Staff 1 and Staff 2 attempted to escort
Youth A back inside, Youth A started to kick and assault
staff, therefore Youth A was put in a mechanical restraint
and transferred to his bedroom. Youth A was in the
mechanical restraints for approximately 2 minutes.
• Medical Incident report dated 10/29/2024, written by Nurse.
Youth A was placed in handcuffs due to assaultive behavior
while being transferred to his bedroom. Nurse noted Youth
A had a split lip and it appears to be related to dryness not
trauma. Abrasions noted on his left and right wrists.
• Facility policy: Physical Management and Mechanical
restraints devices- It is the policy to ensure safety and
security and to prevent injury to staff and students. Safe
physical management of a student may be used in
instances such as justifiable self-defense, protection of
others, protection of property, and prevention of escapes
and then only as a last resort when all other least restrictive
alternatives, to include verbal de-escalation, have been
attempted or exhausted and have failed. The use of safe
physical management techniques and/or mechanical
restraints shall never be applied as punishment. The use
of spit masks is a last-resort intervention to protect staff and
youth from potential harm due to spitting when other de-
escalation techniques have been unsuccessful. Spit masks
will only be used in a manner that ensures the safety,
dignity, and well-being of all individuals involved.
• Discipline and Behavior Policy: Youths are to be free
from corporal or unusual punishment, infliction of pain,
5

humiliation, intimidation, ridicule, coercion, threat, mental
abuse or other action of a punitive nature
Analysis Based on interviews conducted and documents reviewed, no
violation is found. Youth A was aggressive and assaulted staff;
therefore, Youth A was restrained and escorted to his room. All
Staff interviewed denied witnessing Administrator 1 choke Youth
A.
Technical Assistance:
• The facility was advised to include a section on the incident
report to document names of all staff involved, youths, and
witnesses.
• Technical assistance was provided to the facility to update
their Discipline & Behavior Modification policy to ensure it
addresses all aspects of the licensing restraint rules and
their subsections as outlined, prohibiting the specific items
noted.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
